channel.title: macOS on My Blog
channel.description: Recent content in macOS on My Blog

item.title: iMessages/FaceTime logic
item.description: Problems (2 iPhones and 1 Mac): Tel. A (main, ✅ iMessages) Tel. B (backup, ❌ iMessages) email A (login, ✅ iMessages) email B (public, ❌ iMessages) Avoid spam text messages sync to Mac (no TEXTs from Tel. A) disable “Enable Messages in iCloud”: otherwise texts from Tel. A will be synced use iMessage on mac Check “you can be reached for messages at:” despite you disable in the last setting, iMessages can still arrive while regular text won’t.

item.title: VSCode Latex Mac
item.description: Using Latex on macOS Download MacTex (~3/4 GB with most packages included), via homebrew, support for Apple Silicon Guide I followed mostly VSCODE CONFIG LATEX (MAC), which is quite comprehensive and easy to follow. The only adjustment I need is the directory for skim location /opt/homebrew/bin/ if installed via homebrew. Also don’t delete syntex.gz file as it’s required for bi-directional jumping between VSCode and Skim. // latex "latex-workshop.view.pdf.viewer": "external", "latex-workshop.view.pdf.external.viewer.command": "/opt/homebrew/bin/displayline", "latex-workshop.

item.title: Wechat AntiDuck
item.description: There’s this annoying feature on macOS that would lower the media volume when you are on a call or Facetime which appears in Wechat, Facetime or Skype. Basically, you can’t listen to YT when you are on a call. To avoid that, Wechat-AntiDuck comes to help. Fix “No permission to open” sudo codesign --force --deep --sign - "/Applications/WeChat.app" This doesn’t work with the following warning. /Applications/WeChat.app: the codesign_allocate helper tool cannot be found or used Tried re-installing the homebrew version, no luck.
